message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.MM, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with covert communication in wireless networks, which involves information theory (cs.IT) and networking (cs.NI). The use of artificial noise to deceive an adversary falls under the category of physical layer security (cs.CR). The paper also discusses the impact of the path-loss exponent on the covert throughput, which is a topic in wireless communication (cs.MM). Finally, the paper proposes a strategy for friendly nodes to generate artificial noise, which involves coordination and control (cs.SY).
